issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Originally posted by Andreas Hasenack on 2010-06-11 13:04:37.351118+00:00

When fetching data from meta-data, looks like every request that should return a 404 returns in fact a 500 error:
root@ip-172-56-124-250:~# curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/;echo
block-device-mapping/
security-groups
ami-manifest-path
ancestor-ami-ids
public-keys/
reservation-id
public-keys/0/
ami-launch-index
kernel-id
instance-type
local-hostname
local-ipv4
hostname
product-codes
public-ipv4
instance-id
public-hostname
ami-id
placement/

But:
root@ip-172-56-124-250:~# curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/foobar;echo
Failure: 500 Internal Server Error

In the case of Lucid images, which do not have a ramdisk, it also returns a 500, but in this case it's a valid name:
root@ip-172-56-124-250:~# curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/ramdisk-id
Failure: 500 Internal Server Error
fields.summary: Server internal error (500) instead of "not found" (404)

comments.body:
Originally posted by Andreas Hasenack on 2010-06-11T13:04:37.351118+00:00

When fetching data from meta-data, looks like every request that should return a 404 returns in fact a 500 error:
root@ip-172-56-124-250:~# curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/;echo
block-device-mapping/
security-groups
ami-manifest-path
ancestor-ami-ids
public-keys/
reservation-id
public-keys/0/
ami-launch-index
kernel-id
instance-type
local-hostname
local-ipv4
hostname
product-codes
public-ipv4
instance-id
public-hostname
ami-id
placement/

But:
root@ip-172-56-124-250:~# curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/foobar;echo
Failure: 500 Internal Server Error

In the case of Lucid images, which do not have a ramdisk, it also returns a 500, but in this case it's a valid name:
root@ip-172-56-124-250:~# curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/ramdisk-id
Failure: 500 Internal Server Error

Originally posted by Andreas Hasenack on 2010-06-11T19:02:36.219650+00:00

I did the same in my local UEC installation (lucid) and this is what I got on the CC's error log:
